newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Silicon Graphics tumbles.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Silicon Graphics tumbles.

text.p: Silicon Graphics Inc shares fell to 21-1/2 from 23-5/8 in U.S. pre-open trade Thursday as investors sold on the company's warning of below-expectation results for the fiscal first quarter, traders said.

After Wednesday's market close, Silicon Graphics said it expects profits for the quarter ending this month to fall "materially below" market expectations because of product transitions and microprocessor production problems.
Analysts had expected the company to earn $0.29 a share for the first quarter of fiscal 1997, according to First Call. The company earned $0.33 a share in the year-ago period.
The company also said expects revenues to be only slightly above the combined $758 million posted a year ago by Silicon and Cray Research, which was acquired July 1.
With the decline, the stock approached its year-low of 20 hit in July. The year-high is 38-3/4, notched in early December.
Transport Holdings is "looking at least 10 points higher" after Conseco Inc said it agreed to buy it for $70 per share in stock, or $311 million deal, a trader said.
Transport shares were untraded early in the pre-open session, but were bid 66, ask 65-1/2 amid heavy buying interest.
The stock finished yesterday's Nasdaq session at 51-3/4.
Conseco made no moves preceding Thursday's regular-market open, traders said.
Also, Mentor Graphics Corp stock sold off after it issued an after-market warning about third quarter results.
Ahead of the open, the shares fell to nine from 12-3/8, then inched up to trade in the 9-1/2 to 9-3/4 range.
The company said late yesterday it expects delayed customer purchases to cut third quarter revenues to below year-ago levels and net income to slightly above break even.
Analysts were expecting a third quarter net of $0.24 a share, as compiled by First Call, versus $0.19 a share.
Year-ago revenues sales were $107.4 million, Mentor said.
Adobe Systems Inc shares added to gains that came during last night's after-hours trading.
The company reported third quarter earnings of $0.40 per share, below the $0.44 year-ago net but above Wall Street's consensus forecast of $0.35 per share.
The shares rose to 38-1/2 early Thursday, up from 35 at the Nasdaq market close yesterday and 1/2 above the level reached after hours last night.
